title: Google\Cloud\Dataproc\V1\Cluster
name: Cluster
description:
Describes the identifying information, config, and status of a Dataproc cluster

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.dataproc.v1.Cluster

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.project_id
params.description: Required. The Google Cloud Platform project ID that the cluster belongs to.

params.name: data.cluster_name
params.description: Required. The cluster name. Cluster names within a project must be unique. Names of deleted clusters can be reused.

params.name: data.config
params.description: Optional. The cluster config for a cluster of Compute Engine Instances. Note that Dataproc may set default values, and values may change when clusters are updated.

params.name: data.virtual_cluster_config
params.description: Optional. The virtual cluster config, used when creating a Dataproc cluster that does not directly control the underlying compute resources, for example, when creating a Dataproc-on-GKE cluster. Note that Dataproc may set default values, and values may change when clusters are updated. Exactly one of config or virtualClusterConfig must be specified.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Optional. The labels to associate with this cluster. Label keys must contain 1 to 63 characters, and must conform to RFC 1035. Label values may be empty, but, if present, must contain 1 to 63 characters, and must conform to RFC 1035. No more than 32 labels can be associated with a cluster.

params.name: data.cluster_uuid
params.description: Output only. A cluster UUID (Unique Universal Identifier). Dataproc generates this value when it creates the cluster.

params.name: data.metrics
params.description: Output only. Contains cluster daemon metrics such as HDFS and YARN stats. Beta Feature: This report is available for testing purposes only. It may be changed before final release.
